course.subject: SOSC
course.name: Environmental Psychology
course.description: This course examines the transactions between humans and the physical environment from a psychological perspective. It discusses how human behavior is affected by, and affects, the built and natural surroundings. It also explores the human dimension of environmental issues.
course.prerequisites: SOSC 1960 OR SOSC 1980

reviews.author: janhaha
reviews.title: good grade psycho course

reviews.comment_teaching: Kevin is so kind and will answer your questions promptly. But he talks so slow and you really wanna sleep.
reviews.comment_grading:
Investigative projects (25%, 35%)
Essay + discussion in workshops and seminars (Individual)
Attendance to workshops and seminars is mandatory
Submit a preliminary report on seminar and submit final report in one week.
Project 1: 1500 word limit
Project 2: 1800 word limit
Need to read quite a lot reading for the paper
(Details attached below)

Exam (30%).
There will be short essay questions and multiple-choice questions.  

Learning reflection (10%). (500 to 800 words)
Graded on a pass/fail basis


My score:
Proj 1: 15/20 (mean: 15.26)
Proj 2: 25/30 (mean: 24.53)
Exam: 22/30 (mean: 23.15)
Learning reflection: 10/10
Final grade: B+
good grade cuz I just touch the mean for every asm and actually I did not read all required reading
reviews.comment_workload: Not much. Only do some reading for the asm. Do not need the attend the lectures if you are lazy. Just attend the workshops and seminars which are mandatory.

reviews.comment_teaching:
Extremely friendly and willing to answer questions, including questions about assignments. Very responsive and responsible. Reply to your questions/emails very quickly, even at midnight. Should be very generous in grading.

It is great that he would give you feedback about your essays so you know how to improve in the next assignments. And he can finish grading your assignment including giving you constructive comments/advice in a very short period of time.

Showing your personal effort in addition to the quality of your written assignments is also important to score high.

Lecture notes contain little elaboration. You need to attend the lecture and jot down notes in order to understand the content of each topic. The readings are super super important for writing the essays. Read as many as you can. But only readings of 1-3 topics would be used in writing each essay, that is why you have to invest lots of effort but most effort would be useless in doing the assignments because most readings and lecture content won't be used in completing the assignments.
reviews.comment_grading:
-My total score is 70/73 and my grade is A+

-Seminar 1 (10 point): My score is 10/10; Mean: 8.55; High: 10; Low: 6

-Seminar 2 (15 points): My score is 15/15; Mean: 12.08; High: 15 Low: 0

-Essay 1 (12 points): My score is 11.5/12; Mean: 9.51; High: 11.5; Low: 7

-Essay 1 Peer review (3 points): My score is 2.5/3; Mean: 2.39; High: 3; Low: 1.5

-Essay 1 Resubmit (3 points): My score is 3/3; Mean: 2.31; High: 3; Low: 1.5

-Essay 2 (20 points): My score is 18/20; Mean: 15.9; High: 19; Low: 10

-Learning reflection (10 points): My score is 10/10; Mean: 9.72; High: 10; Low: 0
reviews.comment_workload: Extremely high workload. Huge amount of readings and written assignments. Nearly die. For each topic, a reading list will be provided. You can find various kinds of resources that guide you to different corners of the world to observe how humans interact with their physical surroundings and the behavioral processes behind. There will be scientific reports, magazine articles, websites, documentaries, movies, music, paintings, and so on. You will find a lot of inspiration and fun in these resources.
